author: T79
title: Nice, but less so for minifigs
review:
Again an older set I received as a hand-me-down when I was a small child, like the others this one came without box or instructions but in this case that fortunately didn't matter at all.

There is a nice selection of doors included of which my favourites have always been the big yellow 'barn doors'. Since they are from an era before the arrival of minifigs they are rather small with a height of only four bricks. This used to frustrate me to no end as I had these beautiful doors that could hardly be used with minifigs, let alone their tractors.

The fences however have always been useful, 18 regular fences and 4 gates (the only gates in my possession) ensured gardens were always well enclosed as they at least were still at all times compatible with minifigs.

So in the end it really is a shame that those doors are not one brick higher as they would have seen a lot more use then, but with the minifig not yet born when this set came out this can hardly be held against it.
